tuv.seg: Personal Retirement Savings Accounts
Cuntais Phearsanta Coigiltis Scoir
Personal Retirement Savings Accounts (PRSAs) were first introduced in Ireland through the Pensions (Amendment) Act 2002
Tháinig Cuntais Phearsanta Coigiltis Scoir (CPCS) i bhfeidhm in Éirinn don chéad uair tríd Acht na bPinsean (Leasúchán) 2002
A Personal Retirement Savings Account is a long-term personal retirement account designed to enable you to save for retirement in a flexible manner
Cuntas fadthéarmach pearsanta scoir é Cuntas Pearsanta Coigiltis Scoir a thugann deis duit airgead a chur i dtaisce don scor ar bhealach solúbtha
(This is especially important for people with no pension provision)
(Tá sé seo ríthábhachtach do dhaoine nach bhfuil aon soláthar pinsin acu)
Your PRSA is a contract between you and a PRSA provider in the form of an investment account
Conradh é an CPCS idir thú féin agus an soláthraí CPCS i bhfoirm chuntais infheistíochta
PRSAs allow you to change employment and continue to use the same PRSA
Is féidir do phost a athrú agus coinneáil ort ag baint úsáide as an gCPCS céanna
You can also switch from one PRSA to another at any time, free of charge
Is féidir freisin athrú ó CPCS amháin chuig ceann eile ag am ar bith, saor in aisce
Tax relief based on your age will be given by the Government for the contributions you pay into your PRSA
Tabharfaidh an Rialtas faoiseamh cánach duit atá bunaithe ar d'aois ar na ranníocaíochtaí a dhéanann tú chuig an gCPCS
Since 2003 employers that do not provide an occupational pension scheme for their employees are obliged to provide access to at least one Standard PRSA
Tá sé de dhualgas ar fhostóirí nach gcuireann scéim phinsin saothair ar fáil dá bhfostaithe soláthar a dhéanamh do na fostaithe teacht ar, ar a laghad, Gnáth CPCS amháin faoin 15 Meán Fómhair 2003
Employers are required to have provided access to a PRSA to employees who are not entitled to join a pension scheme within 6 months of existing service
Tá sé de dhualgas ar fhostóirí soláthar a dhéanamh do fhostaithe teacht ar CPCS nach bhfuil i dteideal a bheith páirteach i scéim phinsin taobh istigh de 6 mhí ó sheirbhís reatha
There are two types of PRSA:
Tá dhá chineál CPCS ann:
The main difference between the two is that the maximum charges under a Standard PRSA cannot exceed 5% of contributions paid and 1% per annum of the PRSA assets

An príomhdhifríocht idir an dá chineál chuntais nach féidir leis na táillí is airde a ghearrtar ar Ghnáth CPCS a bheith níos mó ná 5% de na ranníocaíochtaí íoctha agus 1% sa bhliain de shócmhainní an CPCS
There are some restrictions on the kind of assets a standard PRSA can invest in
Tá teorainn ar an gcineál sócmhainní gur féidir le CPCS infheistiú iontu
You can read more about the differences between Standard and Non-Standard PRSAs in a Consumer's Guide to PRSAs (pdf) produced by the Pensions Authority
Is féidir tuilleadh a léamh maidir leis an teorainn seo ar CPCS - Treoir don Thomhaltóir (pdf) atá curtha ar fáil ag tÚdarás Pinsean
Standard PRSAs are likely to meet the requirements of most people
Tá gach seans ann go mbeidh Gnáth CPCS in ann riachtanais formhór na ndaoine a shásamh
The level of charges imposed is very important; the charges imposed reduce the fund you can build up
Tá leibhéal na dtáillí a ghearrtar fíor thábhachtach; laghdaíonn na táillí a ghearrtar an ciste atá tusa in ann a bhailiú
On your retirement, the size of your fund will depend on your contributions and the investment performance less charges deducted
Nuair a scoireann tú ó do phost, braithfidh méid an chiste ar na ranníocaíochtaí a rinne tú agus ar cé mar a d'éirigh leis an infheistíocht lúide na táillí
It is not possible to predict investment performance
Ní féidir a rá cé mar a éireoidh leis an infheistíocht
Charges on non-Standard PRSAs are not capped and in most cases, are higher than Standard PRSAs
Níl aon teorainn ar tháillí ar CPCS Neamhghnáthacha agus sa chuid is mó cásanna, bíonn siad níos airde ná Gnáth CPCS
If you are considering a Non-Standard PRSA, ask for a full explanation of the differences between this product and the Standard product
Má tá tú ag smaoineamh ar CPCS Neamhghnáthach, bí cinnte go bhfaigheann tú míniú iomlán ar na difríochtaí idir an táirge seo agus an Gnáth táirge
You should beware of promises of better returns on Non-Standard PRSA products - predicting investment performance is extremely difficult
Bí ar d'airdeall maidir le geallúintí go mbeidh sochair níos fearr le fáil astu ná ar tháirgí Gnáth CPCS - tá sé fíor dheachair déanamh amach cé mar a éiréoidh le infheistíocht
Do you need a PRSA?
An dteastaíonn CPCS uait?
If you are considering whether to invest in a PRSA or are weighing up your options, you should ask yourself the following questions:
Má tá tú ag smaoineamh ar infheistíocht a dhéanamh i gCPCS nó má tá tú ag breathnú ar na roghanna atá agat, ba cheart duit na ceisteanna seo a leanas a chur ort féin:
• Is there an existing pension scheme available to me in my job?
• An bhfuil scéim phinsin ar fáil dom ó mo phost?
If not, you should consider making provision for your retirement and a PRSA may be the option for you
Muna bhfuil, ba cheart duit smaoineamh ar sholáthar a dhéanamh don am a bheidh tú imithe ó do phost agus d'fhéadfadh CPCS a bheith feiliúnach duit

If you already have a good pension arrangement, you may not need to make any additional provision, or you may be able to "top up" your benefits through making Additional Voluntary Contributions (AVCs)

Má tá socrú maith pinsin i bhfeidhm cheana agat, b'fhéidir nach gá duit soláthar breise a dhéanamh, nó b'fhéidir go mbeadh tú in ann cur le do shochair tríd Ranníocaíochtaí Breise Deonacha (RBD) a dhéanamh
If there is no AVC facility, your employer must provide access to a PRSA
Muna bhfuil aon deis ann le RBD a dhéanamh ní mór don fhostóir deis a chur ar fáil duit teacht ar CPCS
• Should I start a PRSA if I already have a personal pension plan?
• An ceart dom CPCS a oscailt má tá plean pearsanta pinsin cheana agam?
You should seek professional advice based on your circumstances
Ba cheart duit comhairle proifisiúnta bunaithe ar do chúinsí féin a fháil
Contact a broker or your pension provider for more information
Déan teagmháil le bróicéir nó le do sholáthraí pinsin le tuilleadh eolais a fháil
• Do I need a PRSA if I already have a defined benefit scheme?
• An dteastaíonn CPCS uaim má tá scéim shochair shainithe cheana agam?
Defined benefit pension schemes promise a pension related to your salary (e.g
Geallann scéimeanna sochair phinsin sainithe pinsean duit a bhraitheann ar do thuarastal (mar shampla, dhá thrian den tuarastal deireanach nuair a scoireann tú ó do phost)
two-thirds of final salary on retirement)
Ní gá go mbeadh ort aon soláthar breise pinsin a dhéanamh
You may not need to make any further pension provisions
Tá riosca ag baint le aistriú ó scéim shochair shainithe go dtí CPCS
Transferring from a defined benefit scheme into a PRSA involves a risk. Assess your financial position and weight up the advantages/disadvantages
Déan do stádas airgeadais a mheas agus breathnaigh ar na buntáistí/míbhuntáistí a bheadh ann duit
• Do I need a PRSA if I have a defined contribution scheme?
• An dteastaíonn CPCS uaim má tá scéim ranníocaíochta sainithe cheana agam?
You are already carrying the investment risk - your pension will depend on the contributions you make, together with the investment performance of your fund, less charges involved
Tá an riosca infheistíochta ag titim ort cheana - beidh do phinsean ag brath ar na ranníocaíochtaí a dhéanann tú, chomh maith le cé mar a éiríonn leis an gciste, lúide táille cuí
If your employer is making a contribution to your existing scheme, you should find out whether this will continue if you transfer to a PRSA
Má tá do fhostóir ag íoc i dtreo na scéime atá agat cheana, ba cheart duit a fháil amach an leanfar leis seo má aistríonn tú chuig CPCS
Investment of your money
Do chuid airgid a infheistiú
Standard PRSAs invest only in pooled funds where the risk is spread across a large number and variety of investments
Déanann Gnáth CPCS infheistiú i gcomhchistí amháin áit atá an riosca scartha amach trasna go leor infheistíochtaí éagsúla
Non-Standard PRSAs can offer wider investment choices
Bíonn roghanna infheistíochta níos leithne ar fáil ó CPCS neamhghnáthacha
However, you need to be sure that you understand the investment choices and the reasons why you should opt for them
Ach, ní mór duit a bheith cinnte go dtuigeann tú na roghanna infheistíochta agus na fáthanna gur ceart iad a roghnú
If you do not understand how your pension will be invested, then you should consider if this product is best for you
Muna dtuigeann tú cén chaoi a ndéanfar do phinsean a infeistiú, ba cheart duit ansin machnamh a dhéanamh an í seo an rogha is fearr a fheileann thú
You should also be sure that you can afford the monthly payment suggested and that this is the most effective payment for tax relief purposes - read more about tax relief and PRSAs below
Ba cheart duit a bheith cinnte freisin go bhfuil tú in ann na n-íocaíochtaí míosúla molta a íoc agus gurb í seo an íocaíocht is fearr ó thaobh faoiseamh cánach
Approval of PRSA products
Táirgí CPCS a cheadúnú
The Pensions Authority and the Revenue Commissioners are jointly responsible in Ireland for approving PRSA products
Tá comhfhreagracht ar Bhord na bPinsean agus ar na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim in Éirinn as táirgí CPCS a cheadúnú
The Pensions Authority supervises the activities of providers in relation to their approved products and monitors compliance with the legislation regarding PRSAs

Déanann tÚdarás Pinsean maoirseacht ar ghníomhaíochtaí na soláthraithe maidir lena dtáirgí ceadúnaithe agus déanann sé monatóireacht le cinntiú go bhfuileadar ag cloí le reachtaíocht a bhaineann le CPCS
As part of the Pension Authority's role, a register of PRSA providers and their products is available
Mar chuid den ról atá ag tÚdarás Pinsean tá clár na soláthraithe CPCS agus a dtáirgí ar fáil

The Ombudsman for Pensions has the power to investigate and determine your complaints concerning disputes of fact or law and errors in relation to occupational pension schemes and Personal Retirement Savings Accounts

Beidh sé de chumhacht ag Ombudsman na bPinsean fiosrúchán a dhéanamh agus cinneadh a thógáil maidir le do ghearáin a bhaineann le easaontas fíricí nó dlí agus botúin a bhaineann le scéimeanna pinsin saothair agus Cuntais Phearsanta Coigiltis Scoir (CPCS)

The Ombudsman has the power to give any directions necessary to resolve the complaint or dispute and can give financial compensation (redress) but this cannot exceed the actual loss of benefit under the occupational pension scheme or Personal Retirement Savings Account

Tá sé de chumhacht ag an Ombudsman aon treoracha cuí a thabhairt le réiteach a fháil ar an ngearán nó easaontas agus cúiteamh airgeadais a thabhairt ach ní féidir leis an tsuim seo a bheith níos mó ná an sochar caillte faoin scéim phinsin saothair nó Cuntas Pearsanta Coigiltis Scoir
The Ombudsman does not have the power to award legal costs
Ní bheidh sé de chumhacht ag an Ombudsman costais dlíthiúla a bhronnadh
All decisions made by the Ombudsman are binding between the parties subject to a right of appeal by either party to the High Court
Ní mór do na páirtithe ar fad cloí le cinneadh an Ombudsman faoi réir ag an gceart atá ag na páirtithe ar fad achomharc a lorg ón Ardchúirt
Tax relief and PRSAs
Faoiseamh Cánach agus CPCS
If you pay a contribution into a PRSA, you will benefit from tax relief at your marginal income tax rate
Má íocann tú ranníocaíocht i gCPCS beidh faoiseamh cánach ar fáil duit ag an ráta imeallach cánach ioncaim
Since 1 January 2011 you have to pay social insurance (PRSI) contributions and the Universal Social Charge on your PRSA contribution
Ó 1 Eanáir 2011 íocann tú ÁSPC agus an Muirear Sóisialta Uilíoch ar do ranníocaíocht CPCS
Where your contribution to your PRSA is deducted from your salary by your employer, net pay arrangements will apply, that is, your tax relief is given at the time you pay the contribution

Nuair a bhaineann do fhostóir na ranníocaíochtaí CPCS ó do chuid tuarastail, beidh socruithe pá ghlan i bhfeidhm, is é sin le rá go mbeidh an faoiseamh cánach/ÁSPC ar fáil duit ag an am a íocann tú an ranníocaíocht
Maximum annual tax deductible is based on a percentage of your earnings
Tá an t-uasmhéid cánach bhliantúil inasbhainte bunaithe ar chéatadán de do thuarastal
The allowable percentage rises with age
Éiríonn an céatadán ceadúnaithe níos airde le haois
(So for example, someone over 40 years of age will obtain a higher rate of tax relief than someone aged under 30 years)
(Mar shampla, beidh faoiseamh cánach ag ráta níos airde ar fáil do dhuine atá ós cionn 40 bliana ná do dhuine atá faoi 30 bliana d'aois)
Tax relief is allowed against your relevant earnings (that is, earnings from employment, from a profession, from a trade or from an office)
Tugtar faoiseamh cánach ar do thuarastal cuí (is é sin, tuarastal ó fhostaíocht, ó phroifisiún, ó thrádáil nó ó oifig)
If you have earnings as a proprietary directory or employee of an investment company, these are discounted
Má tá tuarastal dhá íoc leat mar úinéir stiúrthóra nó mar fhostaí comhlacht infheistíochta, ní chuirtear san áireamh é
"Net relevant earnings" are relevant earnings less losses, capital allowances and certain payments that reduce a person's income for tax purposes such as tax effective covenants

Is ionann "tuarastal glan cuí" agus tuarastal cuí lúide caillteanais, liúntais chaipitiúla agus íocaíochtaí faoi leith a laghdaíonn ioncam an duine ar mhaithe le cúrsaí cánach, mar shampla cúnaint a bhfuil feidhm chánach acu
If you are a member of an occupational pension scheme or of a statutory pension scheme, you may pay to an Additional Voluntary Contributions PRSA
Más ball thú de scéim phinsin saothair nó scéim phinsin reachtúil, is féidir leat íoc isteach i gCPCS Ranníocaíochtaí Breise Deonacha (RBD)
(Separate rules apply here - see AVC below)
(Baineann rialacha faoi leith leis seo - feach RBD thíos)
PRSA providers cannot impose a minimum contribution greater than the following:
Ní féidir le soláthraithe CPCS íosmhéid ranníocaíochtaí atá níos mó ná iad seo a leanas a leagan síos:
• €10 per electric transaction or
• €10 as gach gnó leictreonach nó
• €50 per transaction for other methods of payment
• €50 as gach gnó déanta ar gach modh eile íocaíochta
Contributions received by PRSA providers must be held in a custodian account
Ní mór ranníocaíochtaí a fhaigheann soláthraithe CPCS a choinneáil i gcuntas coimeádta
Maximum allowable contributions for tax relief purposes are as follows:
Seo a leanas uasmhéid na ranníocaíochtaí ceadúnaithe ar mhaithe le faoiseamh cánach:
Age Percentage (%) of earnings*
Aois Céatadán (%) tuarastáil*
Under 30 years 15%
Faoi 30 bliana 15%
*In the case of employees, "earnings" means gross pay for tax purposes
*I gcás fostaithe, is ionann "tuarastal" agus ollthuarastal ar mhaithe le cáin
In the case of self-employed people, "earnings" is defined as "net relevant earnings" (see above)
I gcás daoine atá féin-fhostaithe ia ionann "tuarastal" agus "tuarastal glan cuí" (féach thuas)
From 2011 the annual earnings limit that may be taken into account is €115,000 (€150,000 in 2010)
Ó 2011 tá an teorann tuarastail bliaintúil a féadfadh bheith san áireamh €115,000 (€150,000 i 2010)
This means for example, that someone aged 35 years can gain tax relief on the lower of 20% of their earnings or on the contributions paid in that year
Ciallaíonn seo mar shampla gur féidir le duine atá 35 bliana d’aois faoiseamh cánach a fháil ar 20% dá t(h)uarastal nó ar na ranníocaíochtaí a dhéanann sé/sí sa bhliain sin, cibé acu is lú
Contributions made by an employer to a PRSA on behalf of an employee, are treated as a "benefit in kind" of the employee
Sochar comhchineáil an fhostaí iad ranníocaíochtaí a dhéanann fostóir chuig CPCS ar son fostaí
These contributions are treated for relief purposes for the employer as they are for the employee
Deilítear leis na ranníocaíochtaí seo maidir le faoiseamh don fhostóir mar atá don fhostaí
For example, an employee aged 29 contributes 5% of their earnings to a PRSA and the employer contributes a further 10%, the employee as treated as making a total contribution of 15%
Mar shampla, íocann fostaí atá 29 bliana d'aois 5% dá t(h)uarastal le CPCS agus íocann an fostóir 10% eile, deirtear go bhfuil ranníocaíocht de 15% íoctha ag an bhfostaí
The employee is charged on the employer's contribution as a benefit in kind and must include this on their return of income to the Revenue Commissioners
Gearrtar cáin ar an bhfostaí ar ranníocaíocht an fhostóra mar shochar comhchineáil agus ní mór don fhostaí é seo a chur in iúl ar a t(h)uairisceán ioncaim chuig na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim
This tax treatment makes no practical difference unless the total contribution limits shown are exceeded
Níl aon difríocht i dtéarmaí praiticiúla leis an socrú cánach seo ach amháin sa chás go dtéann an ranníocaíocht iomlán thar na teorainneacha atá leagtha amach
From April 2006 contributions to PRSAs have been disregarded from assessment in means-tested social welfare schemes except Supplementary Welfare Schemes

Déanfar neamhshuim de ranníocaíochtaí le Cuntais Choigiltis Phearsanta um Phinsin ó Aibreán 2006 le haghaidh measúnú na scéimeanna leasa shóisialaigh sin atá bunaithe ar thástáil acmhainne, seachas Scéimeanna Leasa Forlíontacha

If your employer does not operate an occupational pension scheme or where there are certain restrictions applying to the occupational pension scheme, your employer is required by law to ensure they provide access to at least one Standard PRSA

Muna bhfuil scéim phinsin saothair i bhfeidhm ag do fhostóir nó sa chás go bhfuil teorainneacha faoi leith ag baint leis an scéim phinsin saothair tá dualgas dlíthiúil ar do fhostóir déanamh cinnte go gcuireann siad deis ar fáil duit íoc isteach i gCPCS amháin ar a laghad roimh an 15 Meán Fómhair 2003
This rule applies to all employers, irrespective of the number of employees and the status of those employees (i.e., whether they are full-time, fixed-term, part-time, contract, etc.)

Baineann an riail seo le gach fostóir, is cuma cé mhéid fostaithe atá aige/aici agus stádas na bhfostaithe sin (más fostaithe go lánaimseartha, ar feadh tréimhse socraithe, go páirtaimseartha, ar chonradh & rl atá siad)
Contact the HR manager or Payroll Section at your employment to find out about more about the Standard PRSA(s) they have provided
Déan teagmháil leis an mbainisteoir pearsanra nó leis an Rannóg Phá i d'áit fhostaithe le tuilleadh eolais a fháil maidir leis an nGnáth CPCS atá curtha ar fáil aige/aici
You can also read more about pensions and retirement here
Is féidir freisin tuilleadh a léamh maidir le pinsin agus le scor anseo
